Iowa_City.Prairie Lights:
Prairie Lights is an independent bookstore in downtown Iowa City, Iowa, founded in 1978, by Jim Harris.


== History ==
The store's original location was a 1,000-square-foot (93 m2) space on South Linn Street. In 1982, Harris moved the store to an 11,000-square-foot (1,000 m2) space on South Dubuque Street, which had been a coffee house that had in the 1930s hosted a local literary society and its guests, who included Carl Sandburg, Robert Frost, Langston Hughes, Sherwood Anderson, E. E. Cummings and others.
